alert.note: Alert for Perry (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 3:05PM CDT until May 21 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following county, Perry. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 303 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall across the advisory. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain with localized higher amounts over 2.5 inches have likely fallen in the past hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Runnelstown, Tallahala, Corinth and Indian Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
